Count reads over GRanges object

Source: R/BamFunctions.R
countReadsInRanges.Rd

counts are done similarly to HTSeq

countReadsInRanges(
  bam_path,
  granges_of_interest,
  strandedness,
  single_end_reads_flag = TRUE,
  num_threads = 1,
  mapq_filter = 20L
)

Arguments

bam_path

path to bam file
granges_of_interest

a GRanges object of the features over which you wish to count
strandedness

strandedness of library determined by protocol. One of c("reverse", "same", "unstranded") reverse means the counted reads will be on the opposite strand of the feature, same means they will be on the same strand. unstranded counts reads over the feature regardless of strand
single_end_reads_flag

whether or not the library is single or paired. Note: this is not written to deal with paired end reads currently, though you can try. Default TRUE
num_threads

number of threads available for parallelization. Default to 1
mapq_filter

quality filter on read alignment. Default to 20, same as HTSeq. see https://htseq.readthedocs.io/en/release_0.11.1/count.html
